tutorial.title: Super Market Analytics
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use your SQL knowledge to filter some data in your supermarket database and to prepare for promotions and end of year sales

executableContent.instructions:
Let's use SQL filters to gather important information about the items you have in the database.

You want to get an overview of the items currently in the "Fruits and Vegetables" category.

1. Query the database and get all the items where the category is "Fruits and Vegetables"

files.name: script.sql

executableContent.sourceDatabaseTables: {"Tables":[{"Name":"MarketItems","Rows":[{"Cells":[{"CellType":"Header","Content":"name"},{"CellType":"Header","Content":"category"},{"CellType":"Header","Content":"price"},{"CellType":"Header","Content":"in_stock"}]},{"Cells":[{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Salt Crackers"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Packed Food"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"1.99"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"yes"}]},{"Cells":[{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Avocados"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Fruits and Vegetables"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"15.99"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"yes"}]},{"Cells":[{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Red Beans"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Packed Food"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"2.99"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"yes"}]},{"Cells":[{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Boneless Chicken Breasts"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Poultry and Meat"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"5.99"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"yes"}]},{"Cells":[{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Peaches"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Fruits and Vegetables"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"4.5"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"yes"}]},{"Cells":[{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Vanilla Icecream"},{"CellType":"Data","Content":"Frozen executableContent.instructions:
Great work! You now want to know how many items in the "Fruits and Vegetables" categories that are more than 10 dollars. We want to consider doing a sale on these items.

1. Edit the previous query and find fruits and vegetables with a price greater than 10 dollars.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent:
SELECT * 
FROM MarketItems 
WHERE category="Fruits and Vegetables" 
AND 
price > 10;

executableContent.instructions:
Excellent. We want to check the `Baby food` category to see the variety of the items we are offering.

1. Edit the previous query and list "Baby Food" items.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT * FROM MarketItems WHERE category="Baby Food";

executableContent.instructions:
As we saw, some products in the `Baby Food` milk category are not in stock. We want to find these items to plan for restocking.

1. Edit the previous query and find baby food that is out of stock.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT * FROM MarketItems WHERE category="Baby Food" AND in_stock="no";

executableContent.instructions:
Great. So far, we know what items we can put on discount in the "Fruits and Vegetables" category. We also know which `Baby Food` is out of stock.

Next, we need to list all the cleaning products we have in store. Currently, there are more than one categories that has the `Cleaning` word in them. We need to list them all.

1. Edit the previous query and list all items that has the word `Cleaning` in their category names.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT * FROM MarketItems WHERE category LIKE "%Cleaning%";

executableContent.instructions:
Great work. Now, if you notice, most items in the database have a price ending in .99 cents. However, some items have varied cents in their prices. We want to list these items. A discount that rounds these prices would be a nice thing to do.

1. Edit the previous query and list all items that DO NOT have .99 in their prices.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT * FROM MarketItems WHERE PRICE NOT LIKE "%.99";

executableContent.instructions:
Meat and chicken are among the most consumed food items in the world. It would be useful if we can apply some promotions on these items. We want to list chicken and meat products based on whether they are fresh OR processed.

1. Edit the previous query and find chicken and meat products that are in the `Poultry and Meat` OR `Processed Meat` categories.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT * FROM MarketItems WHERE category="Poultry and Meat" OR category="Processed Meat"

executableContent.instructions:
Another way we can go through the items we want to apply discounts on is to exclude the items that seem reasonably priced. 

1. Edit the previous query and find all items in the store that has a price between 8 and 15 dollars.
2. Order them in ascending order.

files.name: script.sql
files.solvedContent: SELECT * FROM MarketItems WHERE price BETWEEN 8 AND 15 ORDER BY price ASC;
